newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Officials unaware of Russia PGM mission to Japan.
newsitem.headline: Officials unaware of Russia PGM mission to Japan.

text.p: Officials at the Russian Central Bank and the Finance Ministry said on Thursday they were unaware of plans for a Russian Central Bank delegation to travel to Japan next week for talks on platinum group metals sales.
"We have no information whatsoever on the Japan trip," said Vladimir Rybkin, head of precious metals and stones department at the Finance Ministry.

An official at the Central Bank, who declined to be named, also said he knew nothing of the trip, when asked to comment on market talk in Japan that a mission from Russia's Central Bank was to arrive next week.

Rybkin also said the Finance Ministry had received no further details on a plan to raise some additional 30 trillion roubles ($5 billion) for the budget through new approaches to the precious metals market and privatisation.
The plan was unveiled by First Deputy Prime Minister Anatoly Chubais on Thursday.
It was not clear how exactly Chubais planned to raise money from precious metals, but sales of gold and diamonds are traditionally a way to bring money to state coffers.
Russia's gold reserves were worth $4.79 billion as of April 1, down slightly from $4.80 at the start of March, Interfax news agency said, quoting Central Bank data.
